newsitem.title: REPUBLIC OF IRELAND: Irish election - State of the parties at 1700 GMT.
newsitem.headline: Irish election - State of the parties at 1700 GMT.

text.p: Following is a breakdown of the seats each party has won so far in Ireland's election, their share of the first-preference vote and the share of the vote in Ireland's last election in 1992, with first counts in from 23 constituencies:
PARTY SEATS WON SHARE OF VOTE 1992 SHARE OF
NOTE - Under Ireland's single transferable vote system of proportional representation, voters list candidates in order of preference.

At the end of the first count, any candidate who has exceeded an agreed quota of votes is elected and surplus votes are transferred to remaining candidates according to the order of preference specified. Another count then begins and this process continues until all seats in each constituency are filled.
